TERMS AND CONDITIONS

Effective Date: 2025-01-01 Welcome to NurivaTech (“we,” “us,” or “our”). These Terms and Conditions (the “Agreement”) govern your access to and use of our services, software, applications, and websites (collectively, the “Services”). By accessing or using any part of our Services, you (“you,” “your,” or the “User”) agree to be bound by this Agreement. If you do not agree to all of the terms herein, do not use the Services.

1. Acceptance of Terms

1.1 Binding Contract

By using our Services, you acknowledge that you have read, understood, and agree to be bound by this Agreement and our Privacy Policy (the “Privacy Policy”), which is incorporated by reference.

1.2 Updates to Terms

We reserve the right to modify or update this Agreement at any time. Where required by law, we will provide notice of any significant changes. Your continued use of our Services after changes become effective constitutes your acceptance of the revised terms.

1.3 Minimum Age Requirements

1.3.1 General Requirement

You must be at least 13 years old or the minimum age required by the laws of your country to consent to the use of the Services. If you are under 18 (or the age of majority in your jurisdiction), you must have the permission and ongoing supervision of a parent or legal guardian to use the Services.

1.3.2 Accounts Created on Behalf of Others

If you create an account or use the Services on behalf of another person (including a minor) or entity, you must have full authority to accept these Terms on their behalf and are responsible for any actions taken under that account. Note: This provision does not alter your obligations in Section 2.2 (Minors and Parental Consent) but clarifies the general age requirement and responsibilities tied to account creation.

2. Data Sharing and Consent

2.1 Consent to Data Sharing

By using our Services, you expressly consent to our collection, use, and sharing of data obtained from partnered organizations that hold your personal or private data. This data will be processed in accordance with this Agreement and our Privacy Policy.

2.2 Minors and Parental Consent

  • Primary Account Holder : If the athlete using the Services is a minor, the primary account must be created and supervised by a parent or legal guardian.
  • Data Privacy for Minors : By default, any data related to a minor remains on the minor’s device and is not shared unless the parent or legal guardian expressly authorizes such sharing.
  • Parental Responsibility : Parents or legal guardians are responsible for monitoring the minor’s activity within the Services and for providing necessary consents on behalf of the minor.

3. Data Collection and Management

3.1 Types of Information Collected

We collect a subset of Personally Identifiable Information (“PII”) necessary for account management, notifications, and the functionalities of our Services. Examples of PII include, but are not limited to:

  • Name, phone number, and email address
  • Organization(s) and team(s) to which the athlete belongs
  • Schedules, participation levels, and related activity data
  • Athletic goals, progress, and personal notes
  • Social media profiles or links (if you choose to share them)

3.2 Data Storage and Security

All PII will be stored securely using industry-standard encryption, hashing, or other protective measures. We take reasonable steps to protect your data against unauthorized access, alteration, disclosure, or destruction.

3.3 Optional Data Hosting

Users of any age may opt in to have their data hosted and managed by NurivaTech. By opting in, you authorize us to store, process, and manage your data in accordance with this Agreement and our Privacy Policy.

4. Data Usage

4.1 Purpose of Data Hosting

When you choose to have your data hosted by NurivaTech, it may be:

  • Shared with a Defined List of Subscribers – Certain authorized third parties (“Subscribers”) may access shared data. You may receive financial or monetary compensation from these Subscribers in exchange for such sharing.
  • User-Controlled – You have control over which parts of your data are visible to Subscribers or remain private. Note: Higher levels of data sharing may result in different compensation opportunities.

4.2 Data Ownership

You retain all rights, title, and interest to the data you provide to NurivaTech.

  • For minors, parents or legal guardians retain ownership rights to the minor’s data.
  • Nothing in this Agreement transfers ownership of your data to NurivaTech or any Subscriber.

4.3 Subscriber Terms

Subscribers who gain access to shared data will be subject to separate Terms and Conditions or contractual agreements, which will be provided when such subscription-based services commence.

4.4 AI Agent Services

We may use your data for AI-driven features, including but not limited to coaching advice, health-related suggestions, or social media guidance. These AI agent services are subject to:

  • Additional Guidelines or Disclaimers – Such as the requirement that AI recommendations do not constitute professional medical advice.
  • Inherent Limitations – AI tools may produce suggestions or predictions that are not error-free. Always consult professional healthcare providers for medical or health-related decisions.

4.5 Opt-Out for AI Model Training

You may have the option, where permitted by law or stated in our Privacy Policy, to opt out of having your data used to train or improve our AI models. If you choose to do so, please follow the instructions in our Privacy Policy or contact our support team. Note that opting out may limit certain AI-driven features or improvements that rely on data inputs.

5. Your Responsibilities

5.1 Accuracy of Data

You are responsible for ensuring that any data or information you provide is accurate, up-to-date, and complete. We are not liable for any issues arising from inaccurate, outdated, or incomplete data provided by you or on your behalf.

5.2 Compliance with Laws

You agree to use the Services in compliance with all applicable local, state, national, and international laws and regulations.

5.3 Prohibited Activities

You shall not, and shall not authorize any third party to:

  • Infringe upon or misappropriate any intellectual property rights in connection with the Services.
  • Use the Services in any manner that could damage, disable, or impair our networks or servers.
  • Attempt to gain unauthorized access to any part of the Services or related systems or networks.
  • Use the Services to transmit any viruses, spam, or malicious code.

5.4 Additional Prohibitions

You shall not:

  • Reverse engineer or attempt to discover the source code or any underlying components of our Services, algorithms, or models (except to the extent this restriction is prohibited by applicable law).
  • Automatically or programmatically extract data from the Services beyond what is permitted under this Agreement.
  • Represent any AI-generated content as human-generated when it is not.

YOUR USE OF THE SERVICES IS AT YOUR SOLE RISK. OUR SERVICES ARE PROVIDED ON AN “AS IS” AND “AS AVAILABLE” BASIS, WITHOUT WARRANTIES OF ANY KIND, EXPRESS OR IMPLIED, INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY, FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE, TITLE, AND NON-INFRINGEMENT.

7.2 No Guarantee of Accuracy or Results

We do not guarantee the accuracy, completeness, or reliability of any data or content accessible via the Services. Any reliance you place on such information is strictly at your own risk.

7.3 AI and Coaching Disclaimers

Any AI-generated coaching or health-related advice is for informational purposes only and not intended to replace professional medical, financial, or legal advice. You should consult qualified professionals before making decisions that could affect your health or safety.

7.4 Acknowledgment of AI Limitations

You understand that AI systems are probabilistic and may produce:

  • Inaccurate or incomplete output not reflective of real people, places, or facts.
  • Offensive or objectionable content that does not represent our views or policies. You agree to evaluate all AI-generated output for accuracy and appropriateness before relying on it, particularly for any high-impact or sensitive decisions.

8. Limitation of Liability

8.1 Indirect Damages

To the fullest extent permitted by law, under no circumstances shall NurivaTech, its affiliates, shareholders, directors, officers, employees, agents, or licensors be liable for any indirect, punitive, incidental, special, consequential, or exemplary damages, including but not limited to damages for loss of profits, goodwill, use, data, or other intangible losses.

8.2 Cap on Liability

Our maximum aggregate liability arising out of or in connection with this Agreement shall not exceed the greater of (i) the amounts paid by you to NurivaTech for the Services in the twelve (12) months preceding the event giving rise to the claim or (ii) USD $100.

8.3 Jurisdictional Restrictions

Some jurisdictions do not allow the exclusion of certain warranties or the limitation of liability for incidental or consequential damages. In such jurisdictions, our liability shall be limited to the greatest extent permitted by law.

8.4 Third-Party Beneficiaries

NurivaTech’s affiliates, suppliers, licensors, and distributors are intended third-party beneficiaries of the disclaimers and limitations set forth in Sections 7 and 8, with the right to enforce them.

9. Indemnification

You agree to indemnify, defend, and hold harmless NurivaTech, its affiliates, officers, directors, employees, and agents from and against any and all claims, liabilities, damages, judgments, awards, losses, costs, expenses, or fees (including reasonable attorneys’ fees) arising out of or relating to:

10.2 Venue

10.3 Special Provisions for Users Outside the U.S.

If you are located outside the United States, local consumer protection laws or mandatory legal provisions in your country of residence may apply. In such cases, nothing in this Agreement will limit any rights you may have under those local laws.
